The Ring of endurance (uncharged) is a discontinued item that was released with Sins of the Father. Like the real Ring of endurance, it could originally be obtained as a reward from the Hallowed Sepulchre.

For unknown reasons, a new Ring of endurance (uncharged) was added to the game a week after release. The original ring was discontinued, and was made untradeable. This briefly led to a glitch where players who had the original ring were unable to trade it.[1]

The ring has an "Activate" option, which presumably converts it into the new ring. It may still exist ingame for any players who have not converted it into the new ring yet, making it a rare example of a discontinued item in Old School RuneScape.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
12 June 2020
(update)
  • The item was made untradeable on the Grand Exchange.
  • The "Wear" option was removed, and replaced by an "Activate" option.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Old School RuneScape's Twitter account. 12 June 2020. (Archived from the original on 3 August 2021.) Old School RuneScape: "We are aware that players cannot trade the Ring of Endurance on the Grand Exchange on some worlds. While we work to fix that, try hopping to another world in order to sell it on the Grand Exchange."

The '''Ring of endurance (uncharged)''' is a discontinued item that was released with [[Sins of the Father]]. Like the real [[Ring of endurance]], it could originally be obtained as a reward from the [[Hallowed Sepulchre]].

For unknown reasons, a new [[Ring of endurance (uncharged)]] was added to the game a week after release. The original ring was discontinued, and was made untradeable. This briefly led to a glitch where players who had the original ring were unable to trade it.{{CiteTwitter|author=
Old School RuneScape|url=https://twitter.com/OldSchoolRS/status/1271379022904274944|date=12 June 2020|archiveurl=https://archive.is/tNlor|archivedate=3 August 2021|quote=We are aware that players cannot trade the Ring of Endurance on the Grand Exchange on some worlds. While we work to fix that, try hopping to another world in order to sell it on the Grand Exchange.}}

The ring has an "Activate" option, which presumably converts it into the new ring. It may still exist ingame for any players who have not converted it into the new ring yet, making it a rare example of a discontinued item in ''Old School RuneScape''.
